label: Description
value: Large cloister or open courtyard. Courtyard contains two fountains and shrubbery.  Architecture is very gothic in style with cluster columns, trefoils, pointed arches and carved figures.  Figures in 16th century costume and dogs in the foreground. Acanthus band across top. Architectural elements are printed in grisaille while figures are printed in polychrome. Contains just over one repeat.

label: Description
value: Neo-classical style; caryatids and affronted mythical beasts between which is a pineapple on a basket. The beasts have the body of a lion with butterfly wings. The main architectectural elements and beasts are printed in grisaille while the capitols, base and foliate band are in green. Printed on faux terra-cotta-colored stone ground.

label: Description
value: Part of a pair of salad servers. Fork has leaf-shaped bowl and monogram applied on pentagonal terminal: "PN"; like spoon but slotted and open.

label: Provenance
value: Pillsbury Michel Inc.; 2008: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Part of a pair of salad servers. Spoon has leaf-shaped bowl and monogram applied on pentagonal terminal: "PN".

label: Description
value: Circular medallion embroidered with Queen Victoria's coat of arms: a shield divided in four quarters, with the three lions of England in the first and fourth quarters, the lion of Scotland in the second, and the harp of Ireland in the third. The shield is surrounded by sheaves of wheat. At top center is embroidered "Victoria Empress of India," and at botton center "1877."  Embroidered in blue, green, brown, white and gold on a peach satin ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal threads Technique: embroidery on satin weave

label: Description
value:
A record of the family of William Lawrence and Alice Ripley. The entire ground is covered in black cross-stitch, with the family dates worked in colored silks, followed by a verse and inscription, and at the bottom two cornucopias of flowers. 
The verse reads: 
Improve Every Moment of youth while you 
May For Life is too short to Be trifled away

Embroidered in colored silks on a natural linen ground. A single alphabet at the top is followed by a verse:

At the bottom is a landscape with a small town, a locomotive, and a horse and carriage. In the center is the inscription: John the Hoog O Love Remember me Margaret Hoog Married 1875 June 3, surrounded by birds and flowers. The entire surface is covered with chain stitch embroidery.

value: 1865-90: Emperor Francis Josef I [1]; 2009: acquired by Museum (from Harald, Peter and Stefan Rath)                [1] This set was ordered by Emperor Francis Josef I for roughly 50 persons, to be used for very special dinners in the Hofburg only (1865-1890).
